page.title: 03Three Farms N.E.of Tregony
page.content: {Tregonhayne}is a dairy-with-arable farm of 250 acres. There are medieval earthworks which include some buildings from the time of Edward the Confessor. The earthworks were in the original Domesday Book. The oldest part of the farmhouse is 400 years old. Eight people live on the farm.The farmer grows Barley,Oats and Winter Barley and Grass for his sheep, South Devon cows and goats and he also farms at Carveth. {Bohago}is a smallholding of about 50 acres, mainly arable with a few sheep. The house was built in 1933. The farmer grows Barley and Oats and Grass for the sheep. {Tregonan}is situated on a hilltop at 100 metres and extends down to a valley at 60 metres. The farmer grows Potatoes, Oats, Barley, Wheat and sown grass for his sheep.
